content.text:
# Transport vessels for the British expedition to the West Indies (1795)

In 1795 Admiral Hugh Cloberry Christian mounted an expedition to the West Indies. The expedition sailed on 6 October, 16 November, and 9 December, but weather forced the vessels to put back. The fleet finally successfully sailed on 20 March to invade St Lucia, with troops under Lieutenant-General Sir Ralph Abercromby. St Lucia surrendered to the British on 25 May. The British went on to capture Saint Vincent and to put down FÃ©don's rebellion in Grenada.
Among the transport vessels of the expedition were 16 chartered from the British East India Company (EIC).

In addition to the vessels hired from the EIC, the expedition used a number of vessels belonging to the Transport Board  on either long-term or short-term contracts.
